p: Respondents were asked if they worked at their own pace during very hot weather and the majority (70.4 %) answered in the affirmative. As to the reasons why the remaining 29.6 % did not work at their own pace (Question 23, Additional file 1), more than two-thirds (68.0 %) attributed this to the pressure from work demands, followed by the pressure from supervisors (46.1 %), and peer pressure (24.3 %). In addition, 11.2 % replied that there was no need to slow down their work rate during hot weather because “Enough has been done to cool the workplace”.
